IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Friday the 7" day of February, 2025./ 18" Magha, 1946.
CC. 971/2018
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poonthura
Police Station in Crime No. 601/2013.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused - Jayasree, aged 57 years, D/o. Lalitha, TC. 43/1154, Puthuval
Puthan Veedu, Near Vaduvathu Temple, Muttathara Ward,
Muttathara Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Ashraf. A)
Charge : Offence punishable under section 324 of Indian Penal Code,
1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused is found not guilty of offence punishable under section
324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and she is acquitted of the said
offence under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
Her bail bond stand cancelled and she is set at liberty.

31.01.2025 05.02.2024 07.02.2025

2 of 5
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offence punishable under section 324 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the previous enmity, on
11.06.2013, at 16.00 hours, at infront of TC. 43/1154, Ambedkar road,
Muttathara Ward, Muttathara Village, the accused had hit on the face of CW1
with a stone, resulting in injury on the left eyebrow. Thus accused committed
offence punishable under section 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Poonthura police station
before the Hon'ble Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II,
Thiruvananthapuram and the case was taken on file as C.C. 2294/2013.
Cognizance was taken for the offence punishable under section 324 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 against the accused. Thereafter, it was transferred to this
court, in pursuance of the order of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as CC. 971/2018.

4. On appearance of the accused, she was enlarged on bail on 24.06.2013. Copies
of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to her under section 207
Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution and counsel for

3 of 5

accused charge framed for offence u/s. 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860, read

over and explained to the accused to which she pleaded not guilty and claimed

to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 and PW2 were examined and Ext. P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW4 to CW6. CW1 reported
no more. Death certificate of CW1 produced. Verified and accepted. In the
absence of any incriminating circumstances against the accused questioning of
the accused under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was
dispensed with. Accused was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence
evidence was adduced from the side of the accused.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 11.06.2013, at 16.00 hours, at House No. TC. 43/1154,
Ambedkar road, Muttathara Ward, Muttathara Village,, accused hit on the
face of CW1 with a stone causing injury and thereby accused committed an
offence punishable u/s. 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(2) If the accused is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point_No.1 :- Prosecution case is that accused has committed offences
punishable under section 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

4o0f5

9. PW1, Prabhukuttan deposed that CW1 is his mother and he denied his
statement before the police. He further deposed that accused is his sister. He
identified the signature of CW1 in the first information statement which is
marked as Ext. P1. According to him, he has no grievance against the accused
and accused has not assaulted his mother as alleged by the prosecution.

10. PW2, Rajan was examined by the prosecution to prove the occurrence. He
denied the statement before the police and deposed that he had not witnessed
the incident that the accused assaulting CW1.

11. The leamed Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and she
is justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused. For the said reason
these point is found against the prosecution.

12. Point No. 2 :- Upon the finding in point no.1, the Accused is found not guilty
of offence punishable under section 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and she is
acquitted of the said offence under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure,
1973. Her bail bond stand cancelled and she is set at liberty.

The granite piece was produced before this court as T No. 410/2013 will be
destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .

5 of 5
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 7" day of February, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial J Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
